content: this legal text summarizes a court case involving the division of community property inheritance among multiple parties the court has ordered the dissolution of the community property and the allocation of assets through the drawing of lots the parties are required to divide movable property such as money and securities among themselves the court also addresses the collation of assets and the allocation of portions the defendants must reimburse the plaintiff for costs related to the maintenance and restoration of the common property the court also deals with the issue of usucaption and the assignment of certain properties throughout the case the parties appeared in court and contested various requests made by the plaintiff bank documents were submitted witnesses testified and an experts report was filed the case was eventually assigned to a new judge after attempts at amicable settlement the court identified the properties to be divided and adopted a divisional plan proposed by the courtappointed expert the court also addressed the division of movable assets and the settlement of costs in the final decision one partys request was rejected the court ordered the dissolution of the inheritance community and described the properties involved real estate can be divided into separate lots as outlined in the experts report the court acknowledged disagreements on how to divide certain assets and ordered lots to be drawn for allocation the court also dissolved the community of heirs movable property including money and securities in a bank account additional claims were dismissed and the parties were ordered to share the costs of litigation the costs of the expert report will be divided among the parties based on their respective shares of ownership
